TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OperationFaultCollection extends System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionBaseCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of instances of the class. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault> class corresponds to the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) `<fault>` element enclosed by the `<operation>` element that is in turn enclosed by the `<portType>` element. For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault operationFaultMessage);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault operationFaultMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which to insert the `operationFaultMessage` parameter.
The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified to the at the specified zero-based index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the number of items in the collection already equals the collection's capacity, the capacity is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If the `index` parameter is equal to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>, the `bindingOperationFault` parameter is added to the end of the collection.
The elements after the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.

public void Remove (System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault operationFaultMessage);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault operationFaultMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the first occurrence of the specified from the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
The elements that follow the removed <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFault> move up to occupy the vacated spot.
